Method Detail

format

public static <T> void format(java.lang.Appendable out,
                              java.lang.String fmt,
                              java.lang.String ctx,
                              java.lang.String key,
                              int lev,
                              long tms,
                              double val,
                              T msg)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.io.IOException
Formats a log message into a buffer.

The escapes sequences start with %, followed by an optional padding character, zero or more digits specifying a display width, and a field specifier character. Each escape sequence is replaced by the specified field of the message, formatted according to the padding and width. The field specifiers are:

  • '%': no field is displayed, instead a literal '%' character is added
  • 'k': the filter key
  • 'c': the context name
  • 'l': the severity level (for this field the default padding is '.', and the default width is 3)
  • 's': the number of seconds in the time-stamp
  • 'u': the number of microseconds in the time-stamp
  • 'v': the floating point log value
  • 'm': the message content (converted to a String, using Object.toString())

    Type Parameters:
    T - the type of message to be formatted
    Parameters:
    out - the output buffer
    fmt - the format defining how the message should be written
    ctx - a context name
    key - a filter key
    lev - a severity level
    tms - the message time-stamp (in milliseconds)
    val - the log value
    msg - the message content
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format string contains invalid directives
    java.io.IOException - if appending to the buffer produced an I/O error

    • format

    lev - a severity level

    See Also:
    for a complete specification of the escape sequences

    formatAsText

    public static <T> void formatAsText(java.lang.StringBuilder buf,
                                    java.lang.String ctx,
                                    java.lang.String key,
                                    int lev,
                                    long tms,
                                    double rep,
                                    T msg)
    Writes a text representation of a log message into a buffer.

    This is equivalent to format(buf, "<%03l>[%k:%c] %v %m", ...).

    Type Parameters:
    T - the type of message to be formatted
    Parameters:
    buf - the output buffer
    ctx - a context name
    key - a filter key
    lev - a severity level
    tms - the message time-stamp (in milliseconds)
    val - the log value
    msg - the message content
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format string contains invalid directives
    See Also:
    for a complete specification of the escape sequences

    formatAsText

    formatAsXML

    public static <T> void formatAsXML(java.lang.Appendable buf,
                                   java.lang.String elt,
                                   java.lang.String att,
                                   java.lang.String ctx,
                                   java.lang.String key,
                                   int lev,
                                   long tms,
                                   double val,
                                   T msg)
                        throws java.io.IOException
    Writes an XML representation of a log message into a buffer.

    This is equivalent to format(buf, "<"+elt+" ctx=\"%s\" key=\"%k\" lev=\"%03l\" val=\"%v\" "+att+">%m</"+elt+">", ...).

    Type Parameters:
    T - the type of message to be formatted
    Parameters:
    buf - the output buffer
    elt - the XML element name
    att - supplemental XML element attributes
    ctx - a context name
    key - a filter key
    lev - a severity level
    tms - the message time-stamp (in milliseconds)
    val - the log value
    msg - the message content
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format string contains invalid directives
    java.io.IOException - if appending to the buffer produced an I/O error
    See Also:
    for a complete specification of the escape sequences
